channel.title: BuddyTV
channel.description: BuddyTV - TV News, Spoilers, Pictures, Profiles, Forums, and Live Commentary

item.title: 'The Vampire Diaries' Episode 4.20 Photos: Klaus Leaves Mystic Falls in 'The Originals'
item.description: Acting on a mysterious tip that a plot is brewing against him in New Orleans, Klaus (Joseph Morgan) makes a trip to the town he and his family helped build. Klaus? questions lead him to a reunion with his former prot?g?, Marcel (guest star Charles Michael Davis), a charismatic vampire who has total control over the human and supernatural inhabitants of New Orleans. Determined to help his brother find redemption, Elijah (Daniel Gillies) follows Klaus and soon learns that Hayley (guest star Phoebe Tonkin) has also come to the French Quarter searching for clues to her family history, and has fallen into the hands of a powerful witch named Sophie (guest star Daniella Pineda). Meanwhile, in Mystic Falls, Damon (Ian Somerhalder) and Stefan (Paul Wesley) continue with their plan for Elena (Nina Dobrev), while Katherine (Nina Dobrev) reveals a surprising vulnerability to Rebekah (Claire Holt) and asks her to deliver a message.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Vampire Diaries' Spoilers: The Originals Head to New Orleans
item.description: The Vampire Diaries doesn't return for a couple of weeks, but when it does fans will get the last five episodes of season 4 in a row. First up: It's time for the prom in Mystic Falls. Once prom is over, the Original vampires will be heading down to New Orleans in an episode titled, "The Originals."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Bones' Episode 8.22 Photos: Booth Does a Little Stripping
item.description: When Booth and Brennan investigate a male stripper during his performance at a bachelorette party, the women at the party also mistake Booth for a stripper. Meanwhile, Booth decides to share in a special occasion with his family in "The Party in the Pants" episode of Bones airing Monday, April 15 (8:00-9:00 PM ET/PT) on FOX. Also check out some behind-the-scenes photos from "The Blood from the Stones."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: The Ultimate 'Mad Men' Drinking Game
item.description:
Can?t wait for Mad Men?s sixth season? Join the club. Since creator Matthew Weiner has continued to be notoriously tight-lipped about the direction for the upcoming season, who knows what will happen when the show returns. So why not celebrate the way the gang at Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce would, with a drink? Pick your poison, whether it?s the old-fashioneds Don Draper prefers or something more innocuous like a Shirley Temple. Then refer to this list of Mad Men-isms when the new season starts and drink the night away!

Always remember, drink responsibly.

Keep up with Mad Men Season 6 with the free BuddyTV Guide app. Get reminders of new episodes and find out how to catch up on previous seasons.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'RHONJ' Roundup: A Brawl, A Reconciliation and a Court Date
item.description: Now that the next season of The Real Housewives of New Jersey has been announced with all of the cast members returning, take a minute to catch up with what's been going on with these ladies in the off-season.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'American Idol' Top 7 Predictions: Who Gave Rock a Bad Name?
item.description: This week, the Top 7 took on some of the most iconic classic rock songs, though they didn't hold strictly to the rules because "Bring Me to Life" is by a modern rock band, and "What About Love" is a power ballad.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Hannibal' Review: An Unappetizing New Drama
item.description: It almost doesn't even seem worth it to review NBC's newest drama, Hannibal, premiering Thursday, April 7 at 10pm. I'll get to the atrocious acting and dull pacing in a bit, but since the show is destined to be canceled, why rush in?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Nashville' Moments: Emotional Highs and Lows from 'I Saw the Light'
item.description: There were plenty of emotional highs and lows on Nashville this week. Though, it was aptly titled, "I Saw the Light," as many characters finally found clarity in their future.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Nashville' Recap: Finding Love in Almost All the Wrong Places
item.description: Nashville ended "I Saw the Light" in rare fashion with all the main characters in a relatively good spot. Well, discounting Lamar's situation of course, though that at least left this viewer happy. After a short break, Rayna and Juliette were back on tour in New York for three shows and had their families with them.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Best ?Supernatural? Quotes from ?Taxi Driver?
item.description: The best quotes from the 19th episode of season 8 of Supernatural.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'American Idol' Top 7 Performance Rankings
item.description: My rankings of the top 7 finalists during "Classic Rock, No Ballads" week on American Idol.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Arrow' Recap: The Count and Vertigo Are Back
item.description:
What happens when the enemy can't be taken out by an arrow? What happens when the enemy is a substance that turns good people into monsters? What's a vigilante to do? 

Arrow opens on a busy night at the club and lots of beautiful people rubbing up against each other on the dance floor. Then there's a girl, a young and pretty girl, who is clearly having a little too much fun. She's high. The kind of high that makes you stare at your hands with intense fascination. She spends so much time looking at her hands that she doesn't realize she was wandered into a busy street and BOOM, she gets hit by a taxi.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Survivor: Caramoan' Recap: The Merge Leads to the First Huge Blindside
item.description: Survivor Caramoan has been a domination by the Favorites and a massacre on the helpless Fans. You'd have thought maybe a tribal switch would have changed things up, but the exiting of Fans just continued at a quick rate. This season has enough giant egos that want to be on top that there always could be a chance for someone to sneak in. If any episode is going to have a big shocker, "Blindside Time" sounds like the perfect one.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Criminal Minds' Recap: Morgan Confronts His Past
item.description: In the season's 18th episode, "Restoration," Morgan's past is re-visited thanks to a case that hits close to home. In part, tonight's episode is a follow-up to season 2's "Profiler, Profiled" -- arguably one of the show's best episodes. Will "Restoration" live up to the quality of its predecessor? Read on to find out what the minds behind Criminal Minds have in-store for us this week.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Supernatural' Recap: Sam Meets an Old Friend in Hell
item.description: This week on Supernatural, Sam goes to Hell to rescue an innocent soul, the second trial in the triad of quests to close the Gates of Hell forever.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'American Idol' Recap: The Ballad-less Top 7 Sing Classic Rock
item.description:
America complained, and American Idol listened. After weeks and weeks of mostly mind-numbing lullaby ballads (or ballabys, as my word-inventing self has decried), the Top 7 are rocking out. The theme this week is "Classic Rock, No Ballads," probably in an effort to keep the audience awake.

The choice should prove very interesting for a few of the contestants, which is good because the ever-predictable results haven't been lately. After finally making an appearance in the final 3, Lazaro Arbos SHOULD be going home this week. And that is irregardless of how he sings, though classic rock in general doesn't lend itself to his particular brand of (sorta) talent anyway.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Following' Episode 12 Photos: Mike Returns in 'The Curse'
item.description: Ryan and the FBI discover a follower who might be able to lead them to Joe Carroll's location. Agent Weston returns to the case but his run-in with the cult may have had a bigger impact on him than anyone originally thought. Meanwhile, Claire and Emma come face-to-face for the first time since Joey?s kidnapping. - From FOX.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revolution' Episode 13 Photos: Neville is Captured in 'The Song Remains the Same'
item.description: Neville (Giancarlo Esposito) faces danger and hard choices as Monroe (David Lyons) doubts his loyalty, he disowns his son Jason (JD Pardo) and gets captured by Miles (Billy Burke). Rachel (Elizabeth Mitchell) and Charlie (Tracy Spiridakos) begin slowly patching their relationship only to be pulled apart again as Rachel suddenly embarks on a quest to restore the power and her self-respect. She must make a dangerous journey to the mysterious Tower as it holds her only chance at redemption. - From NBC.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Walking Dead' Promotes Three Stars to Series Regulars for Season 4
item.description: The main cast of The Walking Dead is expanding for season 4, giving the zombies more food to mucnh on. Chad Coleman, Sonequa Martin-Green and Emily Kinney will all be promoted to series regular for the fourth season, set to premiere in October.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Supernatural' Episode 8.19 Photos: The Second Trial and Benny's Return
item.description: Official photos from the April 3 episode.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Idol' Roundup: Devin Velez Responds to Nicki Minaj's Twitter Rant Against Him
item.description: After Devin Velez was voted off American Idol last week, Nicki Minaj went on a Twitter rant against him. Now Devin is responding to those attacks -- is he hurt by what she said? Also in today's Roundup, following the April 4 results show, additional behind-the-scenes footage will air showing what happens after someone is voted off. And Colton Dixon has received a huge boost in album sales following his return appearance on Idol.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: USA Sets Summers 2013 Premieres for 'Suits,' 'Burn Notice' and More
item.description: As always, it's going to be a busy summer for USA with three nights of programming, including a new drama from the creator of White Collar.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Wynonna Judd's 'Dancing with the Stars' Season in Review
item.description: In week 3 of Dancing with the Stars Wynonna Judd and Tony Dovolani were eliminated. This slideshow takes a look back at Wynonna's time on the show.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Jimmy Fallon to Take Over 'Tonight Show' in Spring 2014
item.description:
It's official, Jay Leno is leaving The Tonight Show. Again.

Confirming what has been rumored for weeks, NBC officially announced that Leno will step down from the legendary 11:35pm late night show and that Jimmy Fallon will take over in the spring of 2014.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Castle Episode 5.21 Photos: Are Castle and Beckett Tracking Bigfoot?
item.description: "The Fast and the Furriest" - When Castle and Beckett find giant footprints at the site of a vicious murder, the team is forced to confront the unlikely theory that Bigfoot is the killer. But as they trek into the world of primate research, big game hunting and mythological creatures, they realize that finding the man (or beast) responsible may put them on the endangered species list, on Castle, Monday, April 15 (10:01-11:00 p.m., ET), ABC.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com
